doc.field: Record Group II: L'Hommedieu Family contains records belonging to Benjamin L'Hommedieu II, but is made up primarily of the personal and business papers of Ezra L'Hommedieu, a prominent New York attorney and statesman of the Revolutionary Era. They include correspondence, legal and accounting records of both personal and professional nature, U.S. and New York State government records, reports and printed materials, published materials, and papers relating to the settling of lands in Central and Northern New York State. In addition, a collection of papers of Ezra's wife, Mary Catherine Havens L'Hommedieu are included, as are a significant volume of correspondence from two of the executors of his estate, Thomas Lester and Thomas Dering, all of which relate to the maintenance and settlement of the estate and upstate New York lands.
